algorithms.imageProcessing.features.mser

Class Canonicalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.features.mser.Canonicalizer

  • public class Canonicalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    class to produce descriptors for MSER, usable for matching same objects in other images.
    Author:
    nichole

      • canonicalizeRegions

        public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions(java.util.List<Region> regions,
                                                                              GreyscaleImage meanWindowedImg)
        NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);
        Parameters:
        regions -
        meanWindowedImg -
        Returns:

      • canonicalizeRegions4

        public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions4(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.RegionPoints> regions,
                                                                               int imageWidth,
                                                                               int imageHeight)
        uses RegionPoints.hogOrientations to make multiple cRegions for each RegionPoints instance. it also make a region for the mser ellipse derived orientation.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • canonicalizeRegions4

        public java.util.Set<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions4(Canonicalizer.RegionPoints r,
                                                                 int imageWidth,
                                                                 int imageHeight)
        uses RegionPoints.hogOrientations to make multiple cRegions for each RegionPoints instance. it also make a region for the mser ellipse derived orientation. NOTE" remember to set cRegion.dataIdx = rIdx in the results afterwards.
        Returns:

      • canonicalizeRegions3

        public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion> canonicalizeRegions3(gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.RegionPoints> regions,
                                                                               GreyscaleImage img)
        NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1);
        Returns:

      • canonicalizeRegion

        public Canonicalizer.CRegion canonicalizeRegion(Region r,
                                                int imageWidth,
                                                int imageHeight)
        NOTE, for best use, invoker should use this descriptor with an image processed to create a window average for each pixel. For example: SummedAreaTable sumTable = new SummedAreaTable(); GreyscaleImage imgM = sumTable.createAbsoluteSummedAreaTable(img); imgM = sumTable.applyMeanOfWindowFromSummedAreaTable(imgM, 2*halfDimension + 1); NOTE the field utocorrelation is not clculated here and my be removed.
        Returns:

      • canonicalizeRegions

        public java.util.List<gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<Canonicalizer.CRegion>> canonicalizeRegions(java.util.List<Region> regions,
                                                                                              java.util.List<GreyscaleImage> pyramidImgs)
        create canonicalized regions containing coordinate maps that can be used to make descriptors. Note that for best results, the pyramidImgs should have been pre-processed so that a pixel contains the mean of itself and its neighboring pixels.
        Parameters:
        regions -
        pyramidImgs -
        Returns:
